Procreate,NA,Frontend Developer,Hobart,"The hidden gem of Tasmania

Nestled in picturesque Hobart, Procreate is an industry-leading creative product company competing on the World stage. We are the recipient of two coveted Apple Design Awards and hold the title as best-selling paid iPad app on Apple's App Store for the past five years. Procreate brings together a rare breed of people who are exceptionally driven and dedicated to help people unleash their full creative potential.

We stand by producing the highest quality software and protecting creativity. We care about our work, our community, and most of all, each other. We’re looking for someone who shares these values and is excited to empower people with innovative, accessible, and intuitive software.
Your impact as Frontend Developer

We are constantly refining user experiences, and the way people interact with us as a product and as a brand. We aim to offer seamless and cohesive experiences at every level. To do so, we’re reimagining our web presence by building a new version of Folio, our art sharing platform, and marketplace. You will join the existing team to help deliver these projects.

As a Frontend Developer, you’ll be tasked with developing delightful, intuitive, and user-friendly interfaces which build upon our established design language. In collaboration with our designers, you’ll turn ideas and concepts into reality.

You’ll work in the Marcom department but will also collaborate closely with our Product Development team. The Head of Web and our designers will be your teammates on a daily basis. In addition, you will regularly collaborate with our backend engineers to ensure that you're working together in the most efficient way possible.
Areas of focus

Work on highly visible user facing platforms. You will play a crucial role in the re-imagination and rebuild of Folio and marketplace. It is the opportunity to work in a well-established company, on platforms with global exposure and reach. You will make decisions on structure and style and your mark will be on everything that people interact with – your work will be seen by millions.

Specialise in frontend development with full stack awareness. The platforms you develop will be front and centre in the communication of our product and allow our user base to interact with us and each other. While you’re primarily concerned with frontend development, you’ll have full stack awareness that allows you to understand what is needed to make the final product possible.

Exercise your creativity and vision. You’ll utilise your technical skills and past experiences in creative and adaptive ways. It is crucial that you enjoy and seek out productive and iterative back and forth with our designers and feel enthusiastic about contributing your own vision and ideas.

Demonstrate leadership and ability to work across departments. Given the size of the team, there are opportunities for this role to morph into a more senior role as we grow and scale. Dependent on your interests and skill set, there will be room to move between web development and product development in relation to user interface design and implementation.
The skill set

A mindset and eye for design. Your success will depend on your ability to bring the ideas and concepts of our designers to life. An understanding of basic design principles will help you have the conversations that are needed to take a concept through to execution. We are searching for those developers with a keen eye for design who approach their craft with a playful curiosity.

Experience leading projects as a frontend developer. You have honed your craft in Frontend development with experience leading or taking significant responsibility for the execution of large-scale projects. An ability to change gears between giving and receiving feedback will set you up for success in our engineering environment.

Familiarity with fit-for-purpose technologies. You're more than capable with JavaScript and CSS and will have worked with Vue.js and/or React. You will have an aptitude for exploring new technologies and ideally have some experience with Typescript. A large part of your responsibility will also be to work closely with our backend engineers to tie the project together. Your understanding of current backend technologies and frameworks will ensure smooth collaboration.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively. You'll work across departments on multiple projects which require input from creatives and developers. You'll be as comfortable talking and working with other developers as you're having a conversation with a graphic designer or other creative. You’ll also need to be comfortable executing your individual tasks and responsibilities.

Methodical and process driven with a perfectionist mentality. Your work will require the ability to see detail and to meticulously reiterate designs and interfaces to ensure the highest levels of quality and user experience. This is a role for the developer who is constantly seeking out ways to refine and optimise whatever they are working on – close enough is never good enough for you.
in 1-3 months, you will...
Complete our onboarding process and become familiar with your colleagues, our workplace culture and tech stack.
Begin working alongside our Web Designer, Frontend Developers, and Head of Web to develop styles and structure for Folio and marketplace projects.
in 3 - 6 months, you will...
Start to finesse the designs and styles as prototypes to make sure that interactions work as desired and that we're delivering delightful and intuitive experiences.
Find and troubleshoot any design problems or pain points.
Make prototypes to reiterate, test and refine any of those issues and go live with your first major project.
in 6 - 12 months, you will...
Begin to improve and rework existing projects and be part of discussions around future roadmap.
Regularly contribute to the marketing and communication department by bringing design to life on a range of projects, releases, partnerships, and updates.
Maintain and ensure that our platforms continue to run smoothly and find and remove any bugs that arise.
We believe in cultivating a diverse and inclusive environment for all

Procreate values diversity in our workplace and community. Discrimination of any kind is unacceptable to us. Our diversity is our strength, and we are constantly working to improve our practices to make sure that we are representative of the society and world in which we live. In our interactions, we make every effort to ensure that all people are provided with the help they need to take part in the interview process, the performance of their work functions and the general enjoyment of their life at Procreate. Fontis,3.6,JavaScript Web Developer,Melbourne,"Want to help develop the next generation of cutting edge online retail sites? We are seeking experienced developers to assist with the implementation of web-based eCommerce systems utilising full-stack JavaScript solutions, progressive technologies, and serverless architectures. Successful candidates will be working in an experienced team, with plenty of opportunities for growth and reward for achievement.

We are looking for technically minded individuals with strong communication skills to become part of our team. To succeed in this role you will be reliable, team-oriented, self-motivated, have excellent time management skills, and demonstrate strong attention to detail. You will be passionate about web development and have an interest in Open Source Software. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills are essential.
Responsibilities:
Work on new website projects, from initial discovery and planning phases through implementation and deployment.
Maintain and enhance existing websites while adhering to software engineering best practices.
Communicate with clients and manage ongoing projects and maintenance requests.
Configure and maintain large-scale websites running on cloud environments.
Work with internal or external designers to implement provided designs.
Lead improvements in the software development process and coordinate efforts with co-workers.
Fontis Benefits:
Casual dress code and fun working environment
Melbourne CBD location with easy access by public transport
Work with progressive tools, techniques and technologies
Large library of technical books, both digital and print for those that prefer dead tree format
End of week catered lunch and drinks at our offices
Applicants should have public examples of work on GitHub, BitBucket or similar - please provide a link to your profile(s) in your application.
Experience with all of the following technologies is a requirement:
JavaScript, NodeJS
Linux
Nginx
MySQL
HTML, CSS
Version Control Software (git, bzr, etc)
Familiarity with any of the following technologies is desirable:
TypeScript
JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as Vue, Knockout, or React
Docker, Kubernetes, or other container environments
Cloud services such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure
PostgreSQL, MongoDB

Trellian,5.0,PHP Web Developer,Melbourne,"Melbourne | Australia
Trellian.com has an exciting full-time role for an experienced PHP web developer.
The role will involve working on various custom platforms and projects including: domain name auction platform, domain registrar, drop catching, domain marketplace and ratings & reviews.
Trellian has a relaxed working environment with a great team and offers many benefits and perks. We are easy going and enjoy a laugh.
We are looking for a developer who is primarily skilled in PHP, JavaScript, HTML and CSS with a few years of solid experience behind them.

PHP (must have, primary language)
Perl, Python
PostgreSQL/MySQL
HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX
jQuery, Bootstrap (great to have)
Laravel, Symphony (nice to have)
Object-Oriented Programming
Linux shell commands
XML, JSON, RESTful APIs
Git source control
Regular Expressions
Spark / Redis (nice to have)
Important attributes:
Self-motivated
Attention to detail
Continuous learner
Team player

Trellian has a relaxed working environment with a great team and offers many benefits and perks. We are easy going and enjoy a laugh.
We are looking for a developer who is primarily skilled in PHP, JavaScript, HTML and CSS with a few years of solid experience behind them.
Requirements:
PHP (must have, primary language)
Perl, Python
PostgreSQL/MySQL
HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX
jQuery, Bootstrap (great to have)
Laravel, Symphony (nice to have)
Object-Oriented Programming
Linux shell commands
XML, JSON, RESTful APIs
Git source control
Regular Expressions
Spark / Redis (nice to have)
Important attributes:
Self-motivated
Attention to detail
Continuous learner
Team player

Salary will depend on skills and experience. Please include cover letter with your application. Apply and be part of an IT Company that has been creating amazing solutions for over 20 years. EY,3.9,Web App Developer,Perth,"At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity

Join our Digital and Emerging Technologies competency and work on a variety of enterprise technology projects across varying industries. Your work will directly impact millions of users across Australia. We are looking for Perth based candidates, though we have a flexible working environment whereby you are not required to be in the office all the time.
Your key responsibilities

We’re looking for Front-end, Back-end, Full-stack Developers (Senior Consultant level) to solve complex business problems. You'll be responsible for architecture, design, integration, solution options, estimation and providing subject matter expertise to our build team, test team, other vendors and client stakeholders. This is a role that requires tech. thought leadership and requires interaction with leadership, both within EY and our client teams.
To qualify for the role, you must have:
Familiarity with front end - HTML, CSS, Javascript, REST and JSON
Experience with React.js, Node.js, Angular.js
Fluency in object orientated programming languages, Java, Python, Scala etc.
Experience in at least one of the following: DynamoDB, NoSQL, Postgres or Oracle
Understanding of .NET framework
Attitude to share / hone knowledge for yourself and your teammates and working collaboratively with a diverse range of team members.
Ideally, you’ll also have an understanding of:
Understanding of Digital led (UI/Ux and beyond) solutions / delivery
Public cloud infrastructure offerings (e.g., AWS, GAE, Azure)
Agile, DevOps and Infrastructure as a Code concepts
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. Cornerstone Digital Australia,5.0,PHP/Web Developer,Sydney,"Sydney CBD, Australia

Do you enjoy developing high quality websites and web applications, learning new technologies, and solving problems? Cornerstone presents an exciting opportunity for a driven and talented PHP developer to join our Calgary team. You will work with the latest technologies while developing CMS and E-Commerce driven websites, often developing custom functionality.
Responsibilities:
Implementation and configuration of CMS and E-Commerce systems (Magento & WordPress)
Working with front-end developers to integrate front-end interfaces with back-end systems
Development of custom functionality and custom modules/plug-ins
Custom application development, maintenance and support
Functional testing and quality assurance
Convert requirements into technical and functional specifications
Researching solutions for functional requirements
Provide development estimates
Desired Skills/Qualifications:
The successful candidate will be a driven and resourceful individual with strong problem solving skills and high attention-to-detail
At least five years of website development experience
Advanced experience working with PHP and MySQL
Strong relational database skills
Experience working with Magento, WordPress or similar systems
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving abilities
Some knowledge of front end development is desirable
Server configuration and management experience is desirable

This is a fantastic opportunity for a person with the right attitude to join a fast growing and entrepreneurial company. Cornerstone is an international organisation with offices in both Canada and Australia, providing internet based solutions to over 300 customers.

If that all sounds good to you, then we want to hear from you! When applying, please include a cover letter along with your CV. Remuneration will be commensurate with skill and experience and all applications will be strictly confidential. Applications will be accepted via email only and should be sent to hr@cornerstone-digital.com.au. Sydney CBD, Australia

Publicis Groupe,3.8,Front End Developer Roles,Pyrmont,"Front End Developer rolesTrading under Publicis CommunicationsLocation: Sydney or Melbourne or BrisbaneFront End Developer (also known as Front End Engineer, Web Developer, Front End Software Developer, Software Developer, CSS Developer, HTML Developer, Programmer, Software Engineer)The purpose of the Front End Developer is to be a hands-on developer working in a cross discipline team to deliver the front-end portion of websites & web applications. Collaborating with other engineers (front-end & back-end), creatives, and clients, the front-end developer may implement web experiences via working in front-end workflows within a project team of technical & non-technical members to help drive business outcomes for our clients.Working closely with UX designers to translate wireframes, this role also requires maintenance & management of frontend libraries alongside the building, testing & deployment of code.This position requires a relevant tertiary qualification or a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in lieu of qualification. Worked in software engineering roles focussed on front-end development for 4+ years.Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, and Javascript.Proficiency in reactive front-end experiences using ReactJS and/or VueJS.Experience building canvas applications.Working knowledge of application performance parameters as well as the ability to assess and optimize them.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbalSalary: $85K – 105K packageSenior Front End DeveloperWe are on the hunt for a Senior Front End Developer to be a hands-on developer working with cross discipline teams to deliver the front-end portion of websites & web applications. Leading a team of engineers (front-end & back-end) while working closely with other creative teams and clients, the Senior Front-End Developer is responsible for building & maintaining various features as per clients’ requirements. This may include the implementation of web experiences via working in front-end workflows within a project team of technical & non-technical members to help drive business outcomes for our clients.Working closely with UX designers to translate wireframes, this role also requires maintenance & management of frontend libraries alongside the building, testing & deployment of code.This position requires a relevant tertiary qualification or a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in lieu of qualification. Worked in software engineering roles focussed on front-end development for 6+ years.Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, and Javascript.Proficiency in reactive front-end experiences using ReactJS and/or VueJS.Experience building canvas applications.Working knowledge of application performance parameters as well as the ability to assess and optimize them.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbalSalary: over threshold so no need to advertiseBack End Developer (also known as Web Developer, Software Engineer, Programmer, Software Developer, Back-End Software engineer)The Back End Developer is an analytical, goal-oriented person who will work with team members to troubleshoot and improve existing back-end applications and processes. Using their understanding of programming languages and tools, the Back End Developer will analyze current codes and industry developments, formulate more efficient processes & solve problems, to create a more seamless experience for users. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication, computer, and project management skills.The role will involve: compiling and analysing data, processes, and codes to troubleshoot problems and identify areas for improvement, collaborating with the front-end developers and other team members to establish objectives and enable the design to be more functional, implementing cohesive codes where necessary to enhance the user experience. The back end developer will also be responsible for developing ideas for new programs, features or products via research & monitoring of industry trends.To succeed as a backend developer, you should be focused on building a better, more efficient program and creating a better end-user experience. You should be knowledgeable, collaborative, and motivated. The ideal candidate will have relevant tertiary qualification in computer programming, computer science or a related field

Artesian Hospitality,NA,Web Developer,Surfers Paradise,"About the Company:

Artesian Hospitality is focused on being an industry leader through the delivery of unrivalled service and an ever-changing experience for its guests. We thrive on creativity and teamwork and are currently undergoing a period of immense growth, whilst we continue to invest in our portfolio of brands.
We are currently on the lookout for a motivated individual who can complement and expand our existing software and web development team.
Job tasks and responsibilities:

We're aiming to find an applicant who can work as a part of the larger team, or autonomously, when needed, on a number of new and upcoming website and web-based projects as well as maintaining and improving our existing software and website offerings. This is an ideal opportunity to learn some new skills or expand your existing abilities all the while getting to work on innovative new projects with support from other experienced team members.
Skills and experience
General Requirements:
1-3 years of web / software development experience.
Formal qualifications are not required, just a proven desire to work on new and exciting projects with similar minded individuals.
Specific Technologies / Frameworks:
HTML, PHP (Laravel / Wordpress), Javascript (Vue.js / Node.js), CSS (SASS), basic SQL
Required Skills:
Should be proficient in HTML, CSS / SASS.
Should have a working knowledge of PHP 7+.
Some experience with Javascript, particularly using Vue.js 3+.
Understanding of mobile friendly / responsive user interfaces and front-end frameworks like Bootstrap.
Understanding of UX / UI best practices.
Bonus Skills:
Experience with Laravel 7+.
Experience with Wordpress.
Experience or working knowledge of Node.js.
Working knowledge of RESTful APIs.
Comfortable with working in Linux.
Comfortable working with databases and SQL.
Experience with AWS services (Elemental, EC2, RDS, S3, SQS, SES, CloudFront etc)
The Perks:

Being part of the Artesian family is your exclusive access to the Gold Coasts best restaurants, nightclubs, day clubs and bars. In addition, you will receive fantastic discounts across our venues (50% off food & beverage) and special offers available from our partners.

Our commitment to growth and innovation within the Australian hospitality industry provides career progression and development opportunities as well as the chance to be a part of a culture that is passionate about the industry and delivering magical guest experiences at every moment.

We're aiming to find an applicant who can work as a part of the larger team, or autonomously, when needed, on a number of new and upcoming website and web-based projects as well as maintaining and improving our existing software and website offerings. This is an ideal opportunity to learn some new skills or expand your existing abilities all the while getting to work on innovative new projects with support from other experienced team members.
Skills and experience
General Requirements:
1-3 years of web / software development experience.
Formal qualifications are not required, just a proven desire to work on new and exciting projects with similar minded individuals.
Specific Technologies / Frameworks:
HTML, PHP (Laravel / Wordpress), Javascript (Vue.js / Node.js), CSS (SASS), basic SQL
Required Skills:
Should be proficient in HTML, CSS / SASS.
Should have a working knowledge of PHP 7+.
Some experience with Javascript, particularly using Vue.js 3+.
Understanding of mobile friendly / responsive user interfaces and front-end frameworks like Bootstrap.
Understanding of UX / UI best practices.
Bonus Skills:
Experience with Laravel 7+.
Experience with Wordpress.
Experience or working knowledge of Node.js.
Working knowledge of RESTful APIs.
Comfortable with working in Linux.
Comfortable working with databases and SQL.
Experience with AWS services (Elemental, EC2, RDS, S3, SQS, SES, CloudFront etc)
The Perks:

Being part of the Artesian family is your exclusive access to the Gold Coasts best restaurants, nightclubs, day clubs and bars. In addition, you will receive fantastic discounts across our venues (50% off food & beverage) and special offers available from our partners.

Our commitment to growth and innovation within the Australian hospitality industry provides career progression and development opportunities as well as the chance to be a part of a culture that is passionate about the industry and delivering magical guest experiences at every moment.

Apply NOW to step into your next rewarding career journey. EY,3.9,Front-End Developer,Sydney,"At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity

Here at EY you’ll work with a team of amazing Technologists who are always growing, learning, and adapting, in and out of the office. Technology is changing the world, and we’re at the centre of it all. With a team list that reads like a who's who in tech, and a highly disruptive business model, we’re advancing the art of team collaboration. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, we’re out to unleash the potential of every team. From Sydney and Melbourne to Sydney and Canberra and across The Ditch, we’re looking for people like you who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative environment.

This particular long-term engagement is an industry leading program of work, whereby you will develop web applications that will positively impact the experience of millions of Australians. Being a high-profile client and program of work, you will gain exposure to a bespoke design system, whilst collboarting with exceptional technologists.
Your key responsibilities

We’re looking for Front-End Developers to solve complex business problems. You'll be responsible for architecture, design, integration, solution options, estimation and providing subject matter expertise to our build team, test team, other vendors and client stakeholders. This is a role that requires tech. thought leadership and requires interaction with leadership, both within EY and our client teams.
To qualify for the role you must have:
Familiarity with front end - HTML, CSS, Javascript, REST and JSON
Experience with React.js
Experience in at least one of the following: DynamoDB, NoSQL, Postgres or Oracle
Attitude to share / hone knowledge for yourself and your teammates, and working collaboratively with a diverse range of team members.
Ideally, you’ll also have:
Experience with Typescript
Understanding of Digital led (UI/UX and beyond) solutions/delivery
Experience with public cloud infrastructure offerings (e.g., AWS, GAE, Azure)
Experience in Agile, DevOps and Infrastructure as a Code concepts
What we offer
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.

We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).

We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.
The minimum salary on offer for this role is $80,000 plus 10% superannuation.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. column1: Rome2rio,4.8,Junior Front End Engineer,Melbourne,"We are looking for Junior Front End Software Engineers to join our user focused product teams. As a Front End Engineer, you’ll work within a cross-functional team to give users the best experience while planning and booking their travel.
Who we’re looking for

We are looking for somebody who is passionate about the Front-End and building user interfaces that are intuitive and that people love. The ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and a “get stuff done” attitude are important to us. Our frontend codebase uses TypeScript and the React framework.
Requirements
12 months industry experience or Computer Science or similar tertiary degree
Experience with JavaScript
Experience in HTML & CSS
Nice to Have
Experience with React
Experience with TypeScript
Why Rome2rio

Rome2rio provides a flexible, inclusive and welcoming team environment. We support team members through flexible hours, a hybrid in-office/work from home way of working and a commitment to good work/life balance. We value learning and development and will support successful candidates in their ongoing learning – through formal training, mentoring and supporting on-the-job learning. For more information and the full list of perks , please see our careers page .

Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don’t apply for roles unless they meet all the criteria. We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re at all interested so you can be a part of growing our products with your unique experience.

As we meet in person from time to time, you need to be based in Victoria, Australia. To be considered for this role you must be an Australian citizen, permanent resident, or have full Australian working rights.

Giraffe Technollgy,NA,Sr. Front End Developer in Sydney or Remote,Sydney,"Looking for a Senior Front-End or Full-Stack Developer with a passion for design and React.js. If you have 3D modeling and/or JS bundling/building, and/or Three.js, and E2E testing experience, you will most likely be the one we are looking for!About CompanyGiraffe is a small, but profitable Australian startup that builds software that empowers decision-makers to create vibrant cities with the smartest way to unlock every site's potential. Our users are property developers, governments, and architects from around the world. If you take a look at the Giraffe App, you will see that our product team spends their time working on:Mapping & GIS (including a 3D model)CAD/drawing toolsOur large UI ""surface area"". Our app is an editor, so almost every part of it is interactiveGeometric calculationsAdministrative functionality like permissions & portfolio managementFrontend performanceAbout the RoleThe Giraffe app sits right at the center of urban systems. We are looking for technologists who love software, 3D design, or mathematics and are excited by our mission to help build better cities. The role is to help us take the application to the next level in terms of UI, performance, and features.You will learn about why buildings and cities are built the way they are - and your work will build towards decarbonization, transport optimization, and more democratic city building.Depending on your strengths and preferences you’ll be building interfaces, frameworks, or generative design algorithms. You’ll be given plenty of freedom to explore and innovate. Our stack is mostly JavaScript, with a smattering of Python, Postgres, and Google Cloud.We are a small team and we need someone who will work with a high degree of autonomy. To be successful, you will need to quickly gain a high level of ownership and responsibility for your part of the product.Being able to work collaboratively and creatively with the rest of the team is a must.We are much more interested in the initiative, curiosity, and a deeper knowledge of computing/mathematics than experience with particular technologies. Remuneration will be based on your ability to demonstrate this as well as on your track record.Experience in any of the following areas would be highly regarded: React.jsJavaScript bundling/building expertise. Employsure,3.9,Web Developer,Sydney,"Own the strategy, performance and functionality of our website
Collaborative and innovative team environment
Australia's best reward and recognition program
The opportunity.
You will be joining a high performing team who are passionate about the brand and work they deliver.

This is an opportunity to work with a company that puts its people first, and own the Employsure website in terms of performance. Your day to day will include enhancement of website features, ensuring that code changes are deployed successfully, and troubleshooting functional or performance issues.

You will be a forward-thinking natural problem solver who enjoys sharing knowledge with their colleagues. You have a passion for digital technology and the focus on the smaller details will be paramount, which in return will ensure your success in this role.
Key accountabilities.
Own the deployment process from Dev to Prod
Identify and resolve any bugs
Website and plugin code maintenance and upgrades
Support with any HTML/CSS/JS on content updates
Ensure content and features are created and launched effectively on production website
Build landing page templates that increase user experience and lead generation performance
Work with our external Dev Ops team
Be the expert for any website features and upcoming technologies to consider
Be a key stakeholder for a number of the upcoming website projects
The right person will have:
2 years’ experience in a Web Developer role, ideally covering WordPress and static websites
Experience in JavaScript, WordPress, HTML, CSS, PHP, Twig
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A problem-solving mind set and the ability to work on projects autonomously
What you get in return
Clear career pathways: relevant quality, productivity and service measurements and resulting remuneration milestones
An additional 5 annual leave days after 2 years of service, plus one extra day for every anniversary year above 5 years (10 extra days in total max)
An active social committee dedicated to organising company & state-wide events & celebrations
Many additional benefits after 2 years of service including paid parental leave, further education allowance, volunteer leave & financial support to name a few
Yearly milestone celebrations
Did we mention free, daily breakfast, office amenities and a bi-weekly tea trolley!
Why join Employsure?

Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure is committed to nurturing a diverse and inclusive culture of opportunity. We encourage applications from people of culturally diverse backgrounds, people who identify as LGBTQI+, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait islander origin, and people with disabilities.

The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.

With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.
Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now Own the strategy, performance and functionality of our website

We encourage applications from people of culturally diverse backgrounds, people who identify as LGBTQI+, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait islander origin, and people with disabilities.

The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.

With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.

Become a part of our exciting journey. Opus Recruitment Solutions,4.5,Wordpress Developer - Melbourne CBD,Melbourne,"An Australian-owned and run specialsit tech company - creating strategic, user-focused custom digital design solutions for local, national, and global brands for over 22 years. You will be joining a skilled team of driven digital professionals in a company that pushes the limits of digital design and innovation to deliver high-quality outcomes.
The Opportunity:
We’re looking for dedicated, driven, enthusiastic and experienced Web Developer to join our multi-disciplined team and deliver premium custom websites.

You're probably used to working on multiple high-end projects at once and know what it takes to deliver quality work with a team of experts around you - we are proud to say our work, and yours will directly affect hundreds of thousands of Australians and global audiences.

You’re interested in practically applying your technical experience and skills, sometimes even pushing your own limits, but love to learn and expand that expertise that got you here to solve real challenging development problems. You understand the value of a properly considered website, and you’re keen to grow and develop your technical skills.
Duties and Responsibilities
1. Define, implement and optimise internal digital systems and procedures
2. Develop websites, apps and digital campaigns with appropriate use of technology
3. Collaborate with all teams to meet project objectives
4. Provide key direction and quality control to improve user experience
5. Manage project delivery to our development standards
6. Assist in quoting work, setting scope and budget
7. Mentor and review the work of other developers to ensure quality
8. Assist in stakeholder meetings, training and presentations when required
9. Establish and maintain trust when dealing with clients
10. Conduct research and training as required to maintain proficiency
What we need:
Agency experience, as a dev and partly a client-facing role.
WordPress (Strong custom Gutenberg), WordPress API, WooCommerce
PHP, JS, MySQL
ACF - Advanced Custom Fields
React and Angular w/ WordPress API backend
MailChimp/Mandrill
HubSpot (Platform & integrations, not CMSHub)
API integrations
Git
Atlassian tooling (Bitbucket, Pipelines etc)
Linux system administration

No Moss Co,NA,Expression of Interest - Full stack Developers,Sydney,"We are inviting Expression of Interest from people who'd love to work as Full Stack Developers (Mid-Level to Senior) at No Moss Co on upcoming projects.*you’re looking for.*Learning opportunities - the environment and psychological safety to learn skills that you’re not necessarily comfortable with, and the ability to learn from others in No Moss.Working as a team on problems - you don’t have to work on something alone.The ability to use your current skills within an environment that values innovation and doing good, while developing yourself and your skills towards your purpose.A consultancy that can offer full-time, flexible working and part-time opportunities, all of which allow for satisfying and challenging work, while leaving room for the pursuit of yourself.we need.We are looking for Full Stack Developers who have a love for solving challenging technical problems, while also having a deep human drive to help those around you be better and more capable people, and are a champion for continuous improvement of the practices in your team.We need you to have the confidence and ability to self-manage in a consulting environment. You are someone who has experience of, and is equally excited about, coaching junior developers, and can foster a safe and collaborative team environment. You might have a history of leading technology teams on projects from small “single-developer” projects, up to larger projects with multiple squads (or if you don't quite have that already, you are excited to keep developing it).You are an outcome-driven person who has a history of trying – resulting in both successes and learning from your failures.We are an organisation who is passionate about growing our ecosystem with individuals who ask ‘why’, have a growth mindset, and who have the same values as we do. We are looking for the right people, and once we find you we can scale and develop your experience to suit our clients and your purpose.Requirementsyou are competent in at least one of the following web application frameworks and languages. This could include:VueJS + Javascript/HTML/CSS,React + Typescript/HTML/CSS,Django + Python,NETCore + C#,Spring Boot + Java,Laravel/Symfony/CakePHPExpress (or similar) + Node.js.as a senior developer, you may have experience using appropriate database technologies in applicable use cases. Skills could include:Relational databases (such as MySQL, PostgreSQL etc)NoSQL databases (such as DynamoDB, MongoDB etc)Deploying databases to cloud service providers like AWS or Azureyou enjoy working closely with product owners, designers, and other developers to create a truly delightful application experienceyou have a good understanding of, or willingness to learn, Agile principles.you have a desire to advise and mentor others, including junior team members, and this is something you want to develop further.you are a strong communicator, and comfortable with explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical clients.you have a desire to learn how to develop with AWS cloud infrastructure.you have experience writing automated tests for web applications.Due to the nature of the role, for example where the consultants are required to visit clients onsite on a regular basis, evidence of double vaccination against COVID-19 is required unless you have evidence of a medical exemption.You're an Australian citizen or hold a current visa to work in Australia.Cover Letter & Resume - Tell us why you'd love to work with No Moss and why this role!BenefitsOur culture and ecosystem are important to us. If our purpose, vision and culture resonate with you, reach out to us. And in addition to that we also have a few other perks
column2: Flexible working arrangements – This could be part-time work, or selecting which will be your office days when we can return to an office again.Remote work with the option to work in our Sydney or Melbourne office.Access to your own personal development coach.Paid Parental Leave6 weeks Paid Parental Leave at full salary for primary carer (not including government-funded parental leave).2 weeks Paid Parental Leave at full salary for the secondary carer.Continuation of superannuation payments whilst on paid and unpaid Parental Leave.Opportunities to purchase leave.Giving back. About 10% of our profits go directly toward our non-profit partners, including One Child and our paid volunteer days with Cause Corps, our not-for-profit micro-volunteering organisation whose mission is to ""make doing good a daily habit.""no moss in a nutshell.No Moss is an Agility, Product Development and Tech Consultancy company that guides businesses to thrive as the very best version of themselves. As a business we are dedicated to growth
column3: growth of our activities, growth of our staff and growth in our ability to ‘do good’.Our purpose is our people’s purpose. That means that we’re looking for ways to help you find your purpose and spend your life in its pursuit and maximisation. We call that the #PursuitOfTheUngooglable.As a consultancy, we provide a special rate card accessible only to non-profits
column4: about 10% of our profits go directly toward our non-profit partners, including One Child and Cause Corps
column5: and our skilled volunteering opportunities are directed toward the latter.We, and hopefully you, want to learn and grow and #DoTheUngooglable. We have a deep culture of teaching and learning: “a rolling stone gathers no moss”, looking after each other: “it’s okay to not be okay”, and customer delight: “a certain polish.""We work with clients, from visionary founders with a dream, to budding scale-ups with millions in funding and market traction, to well-established enterprises in the top ASX 20. We work across a wide variety of industries such as
column6: retail, non-profit, banking, and aged care.*you need.*A consultancy, a product incubator, and an innovation hub that prizes three things:a system of radical transparency. We have an environment of psychological safety, where we are safe to fail. We talk about the customers we lose openly and the reasons why we lost them so we can talk about how to improve together
column7: We have an internally transparent salary grading and rate card, and We strive for transparency to allow our people to focus on making things (and each other) better.a place that values drive. Expect to be asked what your purpose in life is. You’ll spend your career with us in its renewal, pursuit, refinement and sometimes rejection of this declared purpose as you discover something else.an ecosystem of wholeness. We like you for all of you
column8: not just the ‘work face’ you’ve been putting on. There’s room for diversity of thought at no moss, and we’re privileged to continually better our ecosystem toward that end.you like.Getting stuff done. A rigorous process that uplifts people and enables them to be the rolling stone that attains a certain polish. You want to add to these organisational learnings and make us better. You want to share what you already know for the betterment of your colleagues, freely and joyfully. You enjoy putting the extra (smartly chosen) mile in to not work hard, but work effectively. You like conversations where we celebrate failing – personal, team-based, organisational – and subsequent learning.you expect.Other people who are purpose-driven. People who value psychological safety. A place where people are good at listening and incredible at taking appropriate action. To be free to challenge the status quo and each other to greater things. An ecosystem of people who are outside their comfort zone nearly all the time, working mostly in their learning zone, occasionally edging into their terror zone.we like.People who are connected to our story and are inspired to be part of a community. People who want to give back to ecosystems that are finding new, more human ways of working.we expect.People who do what they say and say what they’ll do. Outcome-driven people who have a history of trying – resulting in both successes and learnings from their failures. People who love either strategic consulting, products and/or technological innovation.our people.Ask each other and the people we work with - “How are you?” and listen. They independently seek to learn and grow and are motivated to teach and grow others. We rise to challenges and are resourceful in solving problems. And importantly we celebrate each other’s success.If you have read all of this and feel that No Moss is the organisation for you, but this position isn’t quite what you are after or that you're not meeting all the job requirements, please get in touch regardless via careers@nomoss.co. Tell us your purpose and what you'd like to be doing, so we can give it some consideration for positions in the future.*Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.*Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $75,000.00 – $135,000.00 per year Show more ","Employer Est.:A$75,000 - A$135,000 ",https://www.glassdoor.com.au/partner/jobListing.htm?pos=305&ao=1136043&s=58&guid=00000182acbbb036a542eed4b9b7a15c&src=GD_JOB_AD&t=SR&vt=w&ea=1&cs=1_35b247b7&cb=1660755358133&jobListingId=1008071435223&jrtk=3-0-1gambnc38ih5n801-1gambnc3pg2ok800-883a48f481443646-,NA,NA

column1: Auto & General Insurance,2.8,Web Developer,Toowong,"Work Type : Full Time
Location : QLD
Join the team in this exciting time of growth
Exposure to large and diverse projects
Work with a large team of developers based in Toowong
About us

At Auto & General (A&G), we provide smarter products and solutions to safeguard our customers in their time of need. Our range of general insurance products protect customers on the road, at home and on holiday with various Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents, Pet and Travel Insurance products as well as Roadside Assistance.

Our culture of ‘high performance with high integrity’ underpins our values and the way we interact with our customers, the community and each other. We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.
Your new team
You will be working in an agile team comprising of Developers, Testers, Automation Engineers, Product Owners, Business Analysts and Scrum Masters.
The role

As a Front-End Developer at A&G, you’ll be building technology that empowers our customers to make strong financial decisions and assists with buying and managing their policies online. You’ll also help to develop internal applications that our team members use when supporting our customers in their time of need.
What experience you’ll bring
2+ years’ experience in frontend technologies – Angular, React or Vue
Experience in use of Restful API
Strong experience in JavaScript and/or TypeScript
Understanding of security implications for web applications (OWASP)
Working knowledge of Git, BitBucket, Jenkins (or equivalent)
AWS DevOPs experience (desirable, not essential)
Experience with agile development.
Our perks

Location – Our head office is conveniently based in Toowong Village shopping centre - a city fringe location with access to retail, restaurants, various parking options and public transport. We also have office locations in Kawana (Sunshine Coast) and North Lakes – we’re happy to consider applications from people wanting to work in these locations.
Technology – You know how you work best so you get to choose your laptop (Mac or Windows).
Extra leave - Enjoy additional leave days on us! You’ll receive a paid ‘ME’ day and one paid volunteer leave day annually. Team members can also purchase up to two additional weeks of leave per year.
Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits.
Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar match your donations to registered charities.
Development opportunities - We’re championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses.
Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct Car, Home, and Travel insurance.
Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes.
Onsite facilities - There’s excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers.
Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.
Auto & General values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all.

*A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Work Type : Full Time

Orygen, The National Centre of Excellence in Youth Mental Health,2.9,QA Test Engineer (Junior),Melbourne,"Orygen Digital Melbourne Contract
Melbourne or remote/WFH available
Full-time position until 30 June 2023
Access to NFP salary packaging
Your new job

Orygen Digital is looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) Test Engineer to join our growing team in support of our flagship youth mental health platform, MOST. This will be a varied role with opportunity to use and advance expertise in quality assurance, software engineering, and stakeholder management.
Reporting to the Head of Engineering, Orygen Digital you will:
Collaborate closely with engineering and product teams.
Analyse user stories and use-cases/requirements for validity testing, specification review, test coverage.
Develop test plans, test strategy, and test scripts for new and existing features.
Execute varying levels of testing (Manual, System, Integration and Regression).
What you’ll need
You are passionate, energetic and determined to make a difference to health and wellbeing outcomes for young people. The following criteria must be met for consideration for this position:
Testing environment background
Experience in a product-focused QA role
Experience in manual and automated end-to-end testing, planning and deployment practices
Experience in testing web, API and/or mobile
What you’ll get in return
Salary package between $60,000 - $70,000 commensurate with skills and experience + 10.5% super + NFP salary packaging up to $15,900.
Ability to purchase additional leave
column3: generous Parental Leave Scheme.

column1: Flexible work to suit your lifestyle and access to policies and tools that support this
Orygen – leading the revolution

Imagine a future with unlimited potential. A future where every young person enjoys optimal mental health as they grow into adulthood. At Orygen, this is our life’s work, because we passionately believe it’s what all young people deserve.

Every step of the way, young people and families are at the heart of everything we do. Always. Through world-leading research that creates change. Through pioneering reform that delivers real-world practical solutions.
At Orygen, that’s the future we’re creating right now. To do it, we have revolution in mind.
Join the revolution
If you’re keen to join Orygen and be part of our team challenging the status quo and reshaping the future for young people, apply now.
https://www.orygen.org.au/getmedia/94bf9374-2859-497c-a8fd-f22f35b8fa01/QA-Test-Engineer.pdf.aspx
This is a full time (1.0FTE) contract until 30 June 2023.
Applications will close on 14th September 2022, unless a suitable candidate is found sooner.

Orygen is dedicated to gender equality, diversity and inclusivity. We strive to continue to build a culturally safe workplace where our values underpin the way we work and our commitment to First Nations people of Australia, young people and their families, LGBTIQA+ people and CALD people. We strongly encourage applications from the First Nations people. Orygen Digital Melbourne Contract

Orchard Marketing,4.7,Junior Back End Developer,Sydney,"Technology is literally changing the world around us and yes, some people tend to focus on why that change is bad – it makes us uncomfortable
column2: it breaks our status quo, it feeds our uncertainty – but at Orchard we choose to see it differently. Technology can make lives better. It can make businesses better, brands better and experiences better. It can be the change we want to see in the world.

column1: Which is why we, at Orchard, rally around a single purpose: to invent better outcomes through creativity and technology. Those better outcomes can only exist in the context of people irrespective of if we label them users, customers, patients, clients or even staff.
Join a dynamic and growing creative technology agency
Based in Pyrmont, Sydney and New York
Working with blue chip brands to disrupt industries
The Opportunity

We're on the lookout for a Junior .NET Developer to join our Sydney team. You'll be responsible for integrating HTML templates, developing .NET components & services for bespoke and CMS driven web applications. You'll have experience in implementing content management, application functionality and integration requirements while working within an agile development process.

Working closely with the delivery team and applying industry best practices, you will produce code that is well architected, clean, consistent, and accurate ensuring that implementation meets in the definition of done.
Essential Skills
1+ years design and development of building public facing commercial .NET applications
Solid ASP.NET C# MVC5
Structured and secure REST APIs based on WebAPI
Azure SQL or MS SQL Server
Entity Framework and IoC such as Autofac or StructureMap
Solid understanding of web standards and technologies (HTTP, Request/Response, SSL, Browser caching, cookies, domains, JSON/XML, HTML, DOM etc)
Git workflow
Highly Desirable Skills
Development of CMS-driven web applications based on Optimisely/EPiServer, Umbraco, SiteCore or Kentico
Experience with frontend technologies including as HTML5, CSS3, LESS/SASS and Javascript frameworks such as Vue or React.
Experience with Atlassian suite including JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket and Bamboo
Digital marketing agency experience
Experience of e-commerce application development
What you can bring
Experience in continuous Integration and automated deployment, using build scripts, preferable using Bamboo.
Experience developing a wide range of solutions and working in a team of developers during implementation
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, ideally with a digital agency
Show a strong commitment to the Company's core values of Collaboration, Integrity & Curiosity.
Embrace and respect the Company's community and environmental responsibilities
Applicants MUST have the right to work within Australia.

Above all, the successful candidate to join Orchard will be someone who has a strong work ethic driven by creative passion, positive energy and thrives on challenges, alongside a desire to grow with the company!
If you feel like this is the right job for you, would like to take your career to the next level, work in a great cultural environment that allows you to grow and enjoy work, please apply now.
A little about Orchard
We offer an awesome, fun working environment full of culture and energy. We leave our egos at the door and past that door is a super cool office space filled with inspiring people and free breakkie.

We pride ourselves on our work and also our work / life balance. We're 100% committed to you, your career at Orchard and your continued professional and personal development. We offer a rich array of internal and external structured training and education courses as well as ongoing individual wellbeing support through our Employee Assistance Program.

As an agency we fuse enthusiasm, creativity and technology to Invent Better outcomes for leading International and Australian brands such as Boehringer Ingelheim, Zoetis, MSD, GSK, Taubmans, Westpac, IKEA and Hyundai to name a few.

Invent Better are two little words that define our big approach. It's a belief that creativity and technology are the key to winning in today's digital age, and it's a formula that challenges us to engage with our clients in a way that always pushes us that little bit further every time.
New York | Sydney
Invent Better – make a difference Technology is literally changing the world around us and yes, some people tend to focus on why that change is bad – it makes us uncomfortable
column2: it breaks our status quo, it feeds our uncertainty – but at Orchard we choose to see it differently. Technology can make lives better. It can make businesses better, brands better and experiences better. It can be the change we want to see in the world.

column1: Which is why we, at Orchard, rally around a single purpose: to invent better outcomes through creativity and technology. Those better outcomes can only exist in the context of people irrespective of if we label them users, customers, patients, clients or even staff.
Join a dynamic and growing creative technology agency
Based in Pyrmont, Sydney and New York
Working with blue chip brands to disrupt industries
The Opportunity

We're on the lookout for a Junior .NET Developer to join our Sydney team. You'll be responsible for integrating HTML templates, developing .NET components & services for bespoke and CMS driven web applications. You'll have experience in implementing content management, application functionality and integration requirements while working within an agile development process.

Working closely with the delivery team and applying industry best practices, you will produce code that is well architected, clean, consistent, and accurate ensuring that implementation meets in the definition of done.
Essential Skills
1+ years design and development of building public facing commercial .NET applications
Solid ASP.NET C# MVC5
Structured and secure REST APIs based on WebAPI
Azure SQL or MS SQL Server
Entity Framework and IoC such as Autofac or StructureMap
Solid understanding of web standards and technologies (HTTP, Request/Response, SSL, Browser caching, cookies, domains, JSON/XML, HTML, DOM etc)
Git workflow
Highly Desirable Skills
Development of CMS-driven web applications based on Optimisely/EPiServer, Umbraco, SiteCore or Kentico
Experience with frontend technologies including as HTML5, CSS3, LESS/SASS and Javascript frameworks such as Vue or React.
Experience with Atlassian suite including JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket and Bamboo
Digital marketing agency experience
Experience of e-commerce application development
What you can bring
Experience in continuous Integration and automated deployment, using build scripts, preferable using Bamboo.
Experience developing a wide range of solutions and working in a team of developers during implementation
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, ideally with a digital agency
Show a strong commitment to the Company's core values of Collaboration, Integrity & Curiosity.
Embrace and respect the Company's community and environmental responsibilities
Applicants MUST have the right to work within Australia.

Adasa Sistemas,NA,Software Developer,Brisbane,"Software EngineerWater Digital ExpertsWe help public and private organisations around the world to respond to the demands of integrated water resource management, urban water systems, and water-related natural disasters. We build innovative solutions that link the physical and digital world, using data and advanced digital technologies. Our aim is to help our customers unlock the full value of data to provide descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive insights.Founded in 1988, we have customers in more than thirty countries and our Asia/Pacific headquarters are in Sydney CBD. Our local team consists of business consultants, software developers, data engineers, and data scientists.About the projectWe are building a powerful tool that provides insight to water users to help them make more informed planning decisions and helps our community to understand how water is used, shared, traded and managed.The roleThis role will develop software by studying information needs, conferring with users, studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes, investigating problem areas and following the software development lifecycle.This position plays an important role by bringing new ideas and solutions to the team, investigating, and using new technologies where relevant. This senior role will provide support to junior software engineers for skills development through coaching, advice and training. Also, this role will participate in tasks of planning, estimation, scheduling and staffing.As a senior software engineer, you will train and present new project features to customers and stakeholders.About youYou are a senior developer with demonstrated experience in web programming with a solid knowledge of back-end components and front-end development.You know how to deliver best-in-class software and have experience in designing, developing and deploying software solutions. You work as part of a squad in all the lifecycle of the project from planning, architecture, design, implementation, documentation and customer support.You have sound practice analysing information, software requirements, design, testing and implementing large complex software systems with multiple technologies. You know common software design patterns including SOLID, MVC, MVVM, etc.You are genuinely curious about how things work and passionate about technologies. You like to learn new things every day and feel comfortable sharing with others. You are capable to work individually as well as collaboratively with the internal team and clients.You have thorough knowledge and experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps development practices.General Purpose of PositionThis role is responsible for designing, coding, and modifying software from layout to function according to clients’ specifications. This position works at the front-end and back-end of software projects integrating data from back-end services and databases.Areas of ResponsibilityDesign solutions for the water industry in all the lifecycle of the project (planning, architecture, design, implementation, documentation).Modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance or upgrade interfaces.Directing software programming and documentation development.Consulting with team-members and customers on project status and proposals.Working with customers on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.Analysing information to recommend and plan the installation of new systems or modifications of an existing system.Consulting with engineering staff to evaluate software-hardware interfaces and develop specifications and performances requirements.Designing and developing software system using specific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and design consequences.Preparing reports on programming project specifications, activities, or status.Conferring with project managers to obtain information on limitations and capabilities.Skills requiredBachelor’s degree in computer science or related degree.Strong knowledge of the software development life-cycle.Ability to develop unit testing of code components or complete applications.Full-stack developer with experience in water industry.Experience working on a variety of software development projects.Experienced in end-to-end software development experience.Highly skilled in JavaScript, NodeJS and React.Familiar with CSS, HTML and databases.Fluent in Spanish is idealThe salary range for this position is $AUS 80,000 to 100,000 plus superannuation.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $80,000.00 – $100,000.00 per yearBenefits:Work from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Brisbane QLD: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Education:Bachelor Degree (Preferred)Experience:Software development: 1 year (Preferred)Work Authorisation:Australia (Preferred) Software EngineerWater Digital NSW Government -Transport For NSW,3.9,Full Stack Developer,Sydney,"Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Manufacturing, Transport & Logistics
Job Location:
Macquarie Park, NSW, AU, 2113
Job Ref No: 74114
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
About us

Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.
The Division

We are a trusted partner to our clients, within Customer Strategy and Technology, developing and delivering smart, integrated and sustainable data and analytics solutions which enable evidence-driven decisions to benefit our customers and communities, and leading an uplift in data literacy of use of data insights across the cluster.
The opportunity

Right now, we have an exciting opportunity for a Full Stack Developer in Data Engineering & Architecture team. The work involves working with mobile, web and integration frameworks to deliver great analytics themed products. The role is also responsible for the implementation of various data APIs onto our data platform.

The role requires strong business stakeholder management ability to ensure stability of the AAI team through its growth. The role is permanent full time based at Macquarie Park with flexible work options available.
What you will be involved in but not limited to:

Develop Web/Mobile/API Applications using a range of technologies for the purposes of visualising and communicating information, analytics, and insights to stakeholders.Build wrappers around 3rd party products to deliver a cohesive product-based experience regardless of the backend technologies and provide on-going 3rd level support of developed applications to reduce the impact of production defects and related incidents.Assume technical responsibility for all stages of the software development process to ensure compliance with application development standards and achievement of documented requirements.Utilise technical expertise in the requirements analysis phase to ensure the solution is both fit for purpose and fit for use.Design automated testing and work with CI / CD processes testing to improve the quality and reduce operational risk of the developed application or front-end.Provide on-going 3rd level support of developed applications to reduce the impact of production defects and related incidents.
Please click here to view a copy of the role description.
About you:

Strong AWS cloud knowledge and experience deploying serverless and containerised applications.Proficiency with fundamental understanding front-end languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.Experience developing for a range of mobile devices, tablets and desktops with responsive front-end designs.Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React and TypeScript.Proficiency with server side and scripting languages such as Python, C# & Java.Familiarity with database technology such as PostgreSQL, NoSQL and Oracle.Proven experience in user interface and strong problem solving skills.Excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills.Ability to influence and quickly build relationships.
Salary and Benefits
The salary for this position is Transport Grade 8 ($120,423 - $134,872) plus 10% superannuation and annual leave loading.
How to apply
To apply for this position, please answer all questions within the online application process and submit a resume.
Applications Close: 11:59PM, Sunday 21st August 2022
We are the community we serve
We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and are proud to be recognised as a FlexReady Certified employer for our flexible work policies, offerings and practices. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.
Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.
For any enquiries, please email Jagadeesh Sethuraman at JAGADEESH.SETHURAMAN@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU.
Learn more about how Transport supports people with disability and those providing care via https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us/careers/people-disability
We’re certified as a Family Inclusive Workplace
Our flexible work practices and policies for parental leave, employee and family wellbeing and family care enable us to provide genuine support for our people to thrive at work and at home.
Working with Transport gives you access to a range of benefits that help you balance work with the things that matter to you. Look through our Employee Benefits Guide to learn more.
Apply today to register your interest!
Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.
Take a look at our application tips video series for plenty of great information on navigating and acing the application and recruitment process here at Transport.
Our COVIDSafe Measures Policy
All Transport for NSW workers are required to have:
appropriate evidence of being fully vaccinated with a TGA approved COVID-19 vaccine
an approved medical contraindication.
You will be required to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status or apply for a medical exemption prior to securing this role.

Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.
The Division

We are a trusted partner to our clients, within Customer Strategy and Technology, developing and delivering smart, integrated and sustainable data and analytics solutions which enable evidence-driven decisions to benefit our customers and communities, and leading an uplift in data literacy of use of data insights across the cluster.
The opportunity

Right now, we have an exciting opportunity for a Full Stack Developer in Data Engineering & Architecture team. The work involves working with mobile, web and integration frameworks to deliver great analytics themed products. The role is also responsible for the implementation of various data APIs onto our data platform.

The role requires strong business stakeholder management ability to ensure stability of the AAI team through its growth. The role is permanent full time based at Macquarie Park with flexible work options available.
What you will be involved in but not limited to:

Develop Web/Mobile/API Applications using a range of technologies for the purposes of visualising and communicating information, analytics, and insights to stakeholders.Build wrappers around 3rd party products to deliver a cohesive product-based experience regardless of the backend technologies and provide on-going 3rd level support of developed applications to reduce the impact of production defects and related incidents.Assume technical responsibility for all stages of the software development process to ensure compliance with application development standards and achievement of documented requirements.Utilise technical expertise in the requirements analysis phase to ensure the solution is both fit for purpose and fit for use.Design automated testing and work with CI / CD processes testing to improve the quality and reduce operational risk of the developed application or front-end.Provide on-going 3rd level support of developed applications to reduce the impact of production defects and related incidents.
Please click here to view a copy of the role description.
About you:

Strong AWS cloud knowledge and experience deploying serverless and containerised applications.Proficiency with fundamental understanding front-end languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.Experience developing for a range of mobile devices, tablets and desktops with responsive front-end designs.Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React and TypeScript.Proficiency with server side and scripting languages such as Python, C# & Java.Familiarity with database technology such as PostgreSQL, NoSQL and Oracle.Proven experience in user interface and strong problem solving skills.Excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills.Ability to influence and quickly build relationships.
Salary and Benefits
The salary for this position is Transport Grade 8 ($120,423 - $134,872) plus 10% superannuation and annual leave loading.
How to apply
To apply for this position, please answer all questions within the online application process and submit a resume.
Applications Close: 11:59PM, Sunday 21st August 2022
