Capgemini Australia,4.1,Senior Front End Developer,Perth,"About Capgemini

Capgemini is a diverse collective of more than 330,000 strategic and technological experts based across more than 50 countries, partnering with world-renowned clients to transform and manage their businesses. We are dedicated to leveraging cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms to address the entire breadth of their business needs. This passion drives a powerful commitment - to unlock the true value of technology.

Over the last 18 months, we have tripled our business in Australia and New Zealand, with over 3,300 team members devoted to helping clients get the future they want. Now is the time to join our rapidly growing team who are at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what's possible, collecting unique career experiences with global brands and game-changing tech projects.
Let's talk about the team:

We are looking for an experienced Front End Developer to join our successful Digital practice. In this client facing role you are supporting the Practice to help selling and successfully delivering Web based Solutions for our Enterprise clients.
You will be engaged within a development team, working autonomously and collaboratively to develop world class modern applications.
We will help you achieve your goals by continuous professional development and career progression sessions.
Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

You will have demonstrated solid commercial development experience with an excellent understanding of coding methods and best practices, front-end development skills in Vue.js, JavaScript, C# and frameworks like React / Angular and agile methodologies. You will also have gained a strong understanding of Microsoft technologies with the ability to present these and their benefits to existing and potential clients.
Let's talk about your capability and experience:
Vue.js
C#
Azure
JavaScript
React
Angular

You will need to be a passionate, motivated and client focused. You will be incredibly ambitious, and as a confident, expert Frontend Developer you will be at ease presenting to a broad audience and enjoy sharing your knowledge with your peers.
Let's talk about what's in it for you!

Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. Capgemini constantly aims for excellence in its operations and the employee experience it provides. In line with our Purpose, Flexible Working aims to improve the overall people experience by providing an optimal work-life balance, more autonomy and freedom in when, where and how we work.As ""Architects of Positive Futures"", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways: Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women Capgemini, OutFront, Indigenous, Parents and Carers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious ""A list"" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models, Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030.Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ and listen to some of our employee's stories.
#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it's also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. This starts with our people, working with you to get the future you want. We invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong. Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working - even though you'll want to check out our beautiful offices - and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030.

We work to recruit and retain a talented and diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.

Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory and regulatory requirements.
#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Our Employee Resource Groups Women Capgemini, OutFront, Indigenous, Parents and Carers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious ""A list"" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models, Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030.Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ and listen to some of our employee's stories.
#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it's also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. This starts with our people, working with you to get the future you want. We invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong. Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working - even though you'll want to check out our beautiful offices - and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030.

We work to recruit and retain a talented and diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.

Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory and regulatory requirements.
#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Ever Better Recruitment (EBR),2.1,PHP DEVELOPER - Start Immediately!!!,Sydney,"Your opportunity:
Achieve your potential working with a team of experienced and supportive industry professionals in a rapidly growing financial services company based in Chatswood.
Our client is seeking a hardworking and energetic individual to join their software development team as a PHP Developer in a full-time position.
What you'll need to succeed:
Minimum 3 years' experience in a back-end development role
Experience with NOSQL databases and related implementations
Familiarity with TDD, REST API, MySQL
Understanding of modern development principles and practices (SOLID Principles , Design Patterns ,Object Oriented Programming, TDD ,continuous integration and deployment)
Experience with PHP MVC frameworks – Laravel framework
Previous experience with GIT will be an added advantage
What you'll get in return:
You will be rewarded with a competitive salary and attractive bonuses along with a full-time role in a fast growing and reputable financial services company with a vibrant and supportive culture.
This is an opportunity of a lifetime, don’t let it slip away, Apply Now!
Our agency guarantees that all applications made to our advertised positions are 100% confidential. Applicant resumes will not be passed onto a 3rd party without your prior consent.

Camilla,3.9,Web Developer,Alexandria,"Expanding rapidly into overseas markets, CAMILLA is well on our way to “Colour the world”! With great success already in our UK, US and Australian ecommerce channels we are looking for a Web Developer to bring their expertise and knowledge to assist in the implementation of new and exciting projects.You will need to have experience using Shopify, a solid understanding of OOP and Vanilla JS in the DOM in order to hit the ground running. This is a new role to the team, allowing you to really make your mark!So, what will our Web Developer be doing on a day-to-day basis?Working closely alongside our partner agency to develop and deliver ad hoc and BAU tasks to help drive success across our Shopify platform.Working in an agile environment using business tools such as Jira to complete Scrum & Kanban boards.Submitting merge requests for review to a technical lead through GitLab.Ensure usage of up-to-date techniques and cross compatible code where polyfills are not applicable.Incorporate feedback with precision and ensure delivered tickets are matched closely to acceptance criteria.Working in a fast paced and ever-changing environment to keep you on your toes.Troubleshoot coding bugs and issues and Conduct Root-Cause analysis (RCA) to drive improvement.What are we looking for in our Web Developer?Front end development experience with 3 – 5 years of experience.2 – 3 years Shopify & Shopify Plus experience.B2C experience is essential for the success of this role.Strong communication skills.Exposure working in fashion or retail is an added bonus.Exposure with analytic platforms such as GoogleTechnical skills and Languages: Strong experience in developing world class User Interfaces using the basic (HTML, CSS & JS) as well as using the Shopify supported language Liquid.Strong understanding of Object Orientated Programming.A moderate understanding of Ruby.A moderate understanding of most ECMAScript standards (ES5 ~ ES9).A moderate understanding of Webpack and NPM.A small-moderate understanding of NodeJS and SaaS platforms.Experience with CSS Pre-Processors and modular development.A thorough understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues.Git experience and best practice for adding commits and merge requests.PERKS! Of course, working for CAMILLA comes with some extras: Competitive remuneration and benefits packageA Health and Wellbeing offering including yoga, salsa and meditationStunning Head Office located in Alexandria, SydneyFlexible work practices (we are getting very good at this at the moment)End of Month Birthday Drinks and Quarterly Angel Awards with epic prizesOffice pooch- or pet of choice – companionshipA strong focus on personal and professional developmentDiscounts and Uniform Allowances that will have you head to toe in CAMILLAIf you have the skills we need in our next Web Developer, click apply now!With love xxAt CAMILLA, you are seen for your heart, soul, talent, abilities, quirks, authenticity, drive, and individuality.When welcoming a new member into our Tribe, we encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities and cultures – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability.We will adjust our recruitment process to support accessibility needsEquality will know no boundaries within our walls and wherever we go.Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Expanding rapidly into overseas markets, CAMILLA is well on our way to “Colour the world”! With great success already in our UK, US and Australian ecommerce channels we are looking for a Web Developer to bring their expertise and knowledge to assist in the implementation of new and exciting projects.You will need to have experience using Shopify, a solid understanding of OOP and Vanilla JS in the DOM in order to hit the ground running. Academy Xi,4.3,Assistant Instructor - Junior Web Developer Indigenous Students,Sydney,"We at Academy Xi have an ambitious vision: to transform the world by educating the next generation of digital change-makers. We are passionate about delivering the skills and capabilities required for individuals, companies and government to succeed in an increasingly digital world.Generation Australia is an independent not for profit organization, committed to changing individuals’ lives by providing them with a unique training experience focused on facilitating careers in growth industries where employers need high quality, motivated employees.We have a shared mission to equip people from all walks of life with practical, actionable skills of the future to generate positive impact in the community and beyond. Academy Xi and Generation Australia are proud to partner together for an exciting new online program for Data Analytics.What’s your purpose: We have an exciting new opportunity for an Assistant Instructor to work on a Junior Web Developer program for Indigenous Learners who wants to help us shape the future of the industry.You will be assisting the Lead Instructor to deliver a bootcamp-style program which will give Indigenous learners an introduction to computer science, source control using git, agile software development with scrum, advanced HTML advanced CSS, React, and Node JS-java script web development. Students will participate in project-based learning under your supervision.Duration:  18 Weeks - includes 2-week pre-program and 16-week bootcamp program Hours: 9am-3pm dailyFormat:  Full Time, Online deliveryCommences:  Monday 22 August - Friday 23 DecemberWhat you’ll do: The Assistant Instructor is pivotal to Academy Xi’s next phase of growth and will primarily focus on the following areas

column1: XPT Software Australia PTY Ltd,3.0,Front End Developer,Melbourne,"About us
About XPT
XPT Software Australia PTY Ltd, incorporated in 2016, is a Software Services company
XPT works with top clients across Australia in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Retail, Energy, Mining and Manufacturing domains.
We have 120+ technocrats in Australia working at our client locations.
XPT Software Australia is part of group companies which has global presence across India & Europe.
We have served 100+ clients globally, fulfilling their onsite-offshore needs.
Job Description
Job Description:
o React, Nodejs
o Redux, Yarn, Webpack, Jest
o Jest, Git
Experienced in packaging/minifying the frontend SPA
Experienced in Restful APIs, JWT
Understanding of data and data integration concepts (SQL, data governance, enterprise patterns).
Proven problem-solving skills and the ability to propose new solutions.
Experience with development best practices (TDD/BDD, CI/CD and other DevSecOps concepts).
Understanding of APIs and related concepts (OData, GraphQL, API Gateways, OAuth, Swagger etc.).
Good experience in handling authorization using JWT or any other similar methodology.
Good exposure in containerizing applications with Docker.
Hands on with cloud environments. AWS with EKS preferred.Experience in Agile delivery model.
About XPT:

XPT Software Australia PTY Ltd, incorporated in 2016, is a Software services company catering to a vast variety of clients across Australia in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Mining and Manufacturing etc domains.
We have 90+ technocrats in Australia working at our client project locations at Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide etc.
We engage with our clients for their IT services, R&D, Staff augmentation and Permanent hiring needs for Australia
XPT Software Australia is part of group companies which has global presence across India (Bengaluru, Chandigarh), Europe ( Berlin, Sweden, Poland)
We have served 100+ clients globally fulfilling their onsite-offshore needs through local hiring or sponsored work visas
With our strengths and capabilities, we aspire to support GLOBAL OEMs, Tier 1, Tier 2 companies in Automotive, Aerospace, BFSI, Consumer/Healthcare and Telecom space

column1: Woocom,NA,Senior Web Developer - PHP / Joomla,Osborne Park,"We are looking for an experienced PHP / MySQL developer with a strong understanding of Joomla based developments.

The ability to custom develop applications to suit clients' needs
Working as a team player focussing on clients' results

Developing PHP / MySQL applications
Advanced understanding of Linux and Amazon web services

Good Photoshop skills

Flexible can-do attitude and willingness to learn
Good written, interpersonal and communication skills
3-5 years experience in a similar role
A portfolio of websites and applications
Bachelors Degree in Information Technology/Computer Science (preferable but not essential)

Pictura Creative,NA,Web Developer,North Sydney,"We are looking for a talented and resourceful individual with at least 3 years experience and a proven track record developing high quality, professional websites across the board including for small to medium size businesses, e-commerce and more. The projects we work on are varied and a strong understanding of marketing focused design is a must.
You have a strong procedural approach to development with ability to develop site maps, wireframes and be involved in UI decisions.

Fresh, creative ideas and the ability to be resourceful is essential. You are always seeking inspiration and pushing creative boundaries. Resourceful is essential as you will work on websites for small businesses through to large projects.

Please note: this is not a role for someone who can only implement a theme in Wordpress, this is a role for someone with proven coding abilities with an attention to detail and passion for boutique web development.
Skills:
3 years+ web development experience.
Software: PS, Sketch, OS X.
Experience with a variety of CMS and E-commerce platforms, Wordpress is essential.
Frameworks such as Angular.js, React.js or other JavaScript frameworks.
Advanced HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP, MySQL.
Experience with GIT source control.
Ability to think fast and troubleshoot server-related issues.
Must have:
Excellent communication skills and ability to work well and interact with all team members.
Excellent debugging skills, unit testing and knowledge of build automation, continuous integration and continuous delivery practices.
Desire to self educate and learn.
Strong passion for web development and design.
Creative problem solving and ability to think outside the square.
Attention to detail.
Responsibilities include:
Wordpress website development from custom designs, not templates.
Making changes to existing websites developed in Wordpress, other CMS, or HTML.
Setting up Analytics and configuring custom goals.
Develop and code EDMs.
Manage the web server and other IT related issues including internet and web services.
Develop custom solutions within existing web systems or from scratch.
What do we have to offer?
Creative environment.
Close to public transport, cafes and restaurants.
Diverse, challenging creative work.
Ownership of projects and extended responsibilities.
Opportunity to grow and develop knew skills.
Salary based on experience.

Telstra,3.9,Software Engineer,Australia,"At Telstra, we believe the more connected people are, the more opportunities they have. That's why we help create a brilliant connected future for everyone, every day.

As a Software Engineer, you will design, develop and maintain software applications that are useable, robust and scalable. You will implement best practice design and user experience, ensuring that the software meets both functional and non-functional requirement of Telstra Health and its customers. Analysing requirements and developing documents which specify solutions to these requirements is key.
Your Impact:
Ensure that developed software meets the business aims of the company and its customers.
Participate in the entire software development lifecycle from the concept state through to release
Work with QA, BA, developers and UX to ensure development quality is maintained at the highest standard
Provide technical solutions in terms of code, design and industry best practices to ensure a quality product.
Document technical designs to enable stakeholders and governance teams to review and endorse solutions being implemented.
Development of new functionality as well as refactoring, troubleshooting and addressing defects found
We are looking for someone who can clearly demonstrate a number of key attributes and skills:
Extensive experience in software development, including exposure to all facets of the SDLC.
Clear understanding and experience of working in Agile Software development framework specially particularly TDD / BDD
Strong experience with Web application using Java, Spring, Hibernate, JDBC
Proven experience on HTML 5 and CSS/SCSS.
Strong experience with at least one modern front end framework such as Angular, React, Stencil
Database development using a relational database
End to end software integration.
Development testing knowledge - Unit testing
Health industry and integration (HL7, FHIR) experience desired but nor mandatory.
Highly regarded: Java certifications in software development or database development.
Why join us?
Your work will expose you to innovative thinking, technologies and global best practice. As we grow, you'll grow, and this will extend onto building your own valuable talents and skills here with us.
Interested?
If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!
To learn more about how we support our people, including accessibility adjustments we can provide you through the recruitment process, visit tel.st/thrive.
Fixed Remuneration: 87,600 AUD - 131,400 AUD

Costa,3.4,SAP ABAP Developer - Melbourne,Ravenhall,"About Costa:
Costa, an ASX listed company, is Australia’s leading grower, packer and marketer of premium quality fresh fruit and vegetables.

On the land, in distribution centres, and out on the roads – Costa people work hard to bring the freshest produce to tables across Australia. But joining our team is about more than just hard work. It’s about picking a meaningful, sustainable job that’s good for you, and for Australia. Costa is committed to sustainable agriculture. Not only is it a key strategy for maximising our profitability, it’s also crucial to ensuring that our country’s natural resources are utilised in both an environmentally responsible and efficient manner. By taking this approach, Costa grows products which are healthy, safe and of the highest quality, while at the same time protecting and improving the natural environment. With over 60 farms across Australia, our produce includes avocados, berries, citrus, grapes, mushroom and tomatoes.
Our produce is supplied to all the major Australian supermarket chains, as well as independent grocers and a range of food industry stakeholders. We also export to Asia, North America and Europe.
About the Role:

This position offers an opportunity to an ambitious and career minded individual wanting to be part of a great team within Costa. You will be part of the Technology Solutions Team, developing solutions both for SAP ECC6 and in BW/4HANA.
The role involves:
Design, develop and test custom programs, transactions, custom tables and data objects based on functional requirements in SAP ECC6
Assist with day to day SAP support (level 2 and 3) and effectively engage with the business to provide viable and best practice solutions.
Develop, test and implement Enhancements / BAdi's/ user exits to standard SAP programs
Develop, test and implement custom reports, BAPI's, RFCs
Develop, test and implement APIs (OData Gateway Services) for consumption by web applications and mobile devices
Develop, test and implement SAP forms (Adobe PDF Print Forms, Smartforms)
Provide technical documentation of all developed programs and transactions based on functional requirements.
Ensure all processes in your area are covered thoroughly for Integration and UAT test cycles.
Investigate and resolve efforts, defects, and incidents reported on the test and production systems as required.
Perform all necessary steps to ensure smooth Cutover.
Meet project deadlines. Participate in project planning activities and manage the execution of work program according to plan.
Work closely with other developers, technical and functional team members to deliver and deploy outcomes.
Based in our corporate head office in Melbourne (Western suburbs), this permanent full time role offers flexible working arrangements including work from home if desired.
About You:
The successful candidate will have a proven SAP technical and functional experience, excellent communication skills, team skills, and knowledge of ITIL tools, methodologies, and approaches.
Key skills and experience required for this role include:
Expert knowledge in ABAP, ABAP OO and related development technologies (minimum of 8 years of experience)
Outstanding technical skills, with the ability to understand complex processes and systems
Good understanding of core SAP functional areas
Experienced in a commercial IT development environment.
Exceptional communication, organisational skills, both written and verbal
Must be a team player with experience in working across multiple technology teams
Ability to work across a complex IT environment in a global environment
Passionate about building a service delivery culture to Costa Technology
Resilient and supportive to manage change in behaviours, technology and processes
Preferred Skills:
Understanding of Microsoft Azure platform options for integration with SAP
Experience in working in an agile environment
Experience with Eclipse as IDE for ABAP development
Experience with Git for source control (ABAPgit)
For further information please contact Mark Brown (CIO) mark.brown@costagroup.com.au

Advisible,5.0,SEO Web Developer,Sydney,"We’re looking for an SEO Web Developer who is experienced and passionate about the technical side of SEO and analytics.

Working at AdVisible is an amazing opportunity because we put our team and clients first. By combining our passion for people with our +10 years of experience, we help our clients unlock their full potential online using digital marketing.

This is your chance joining an award winning agency with an amazing company culture. You’ll be part of a fast growing agency and dynamic environment where your teammates support your personal and professional growth.
This role will involve working closely with our SEO specialists and web team on some very exciting clients.
The Responsibilities:
Efficiently work across multiple SEO campaigns Conduct technical site audits
Implement SEO fixes on clients websites such as URL structure, XML sitemaps, crawl errors, broken links, internal linking, improving code, load speed, duplicate content, schema markup etc.)
GA, GSC & GTM implementation
Monitor GSC for errors and implemented fixes
Lead site migration projects
Analyse campaign reporting and make strategic and actionable suggestions
Assist web team with web projects and web support packages
The right candidate will have:
Worked within an agency
+2 years of development experience working across multiple accounts
Advanced working knowledge of HTML,CSS, and JS
Knowledge of MySQL and PHP
Proficient with SEMRush, Ahrefs, Screaming frog, and DeepCrawl
Experience with CMS platforms such as WordPress and Shopify
Good communication skills (verbal and written)
Impeccable analytical, organisational and time management skills
Versatility to perform tasks independently and collaborate with the wider team
Commitment to follow new SEO trends, ranking factors and algorithm updates
Why AdVisible?
Be part of a fast-growing and award-winning agency
Amazing company culture – close knit family
Competitive salary based on experience
Transparent career progression with annual performance reviews
Convenient Sydney CBD office
Stocked kitchen
End of year company trip
It’s important that you share similar core values to what we’ve built our culture on:
Passion
Positivity
Growth
Teamwork
How To Apply:
AdVisible promises to provide you with a supportive environment to increase job satisfaction, job security and personal growth.

If you meet the above requirements and think you’ll make a great cultural fit, apply below or email your cover letter and CV to andrew@advisible.com.au. We’re looking for an SEO Web Developer who is experienced and passionate about the technical side of SEO and analytics.

Deloitte,4.0,Web developer (Angular + .Net Core),Melbourne,"Date: 04-Aug-2022
Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU
Department: Consulting
Description:
Job Requisition ID: 30352
Web developer (Angular + .Net Core)
Agile working environment
Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best
Salary packaging – to suit your personal and financial circumstances
We are looking for a full-time experienced Angular web developer to join our team developing home-built cloud- based Data Management Platform. Flexible WFH (work from home) options are available.
What will your typical day look like?

Deloitte Match Cloud is a Data Management and Data Quality cloud-based platform developed by Deloitte. As a Web Developer, you will be working closely with our Match Cloud team developing this platform.

We are looking for a person who is passionate about building dynamic data-driven modern web applications with responsive design to join our team and make an impact on delivering a high-quality solution to our existing and new clients.

Your responsibilities will include developing web-based and mobile responsive application, integrating back-end and 3rd party APIs into the existing cloud-based platform, working on the quality and effectiveness of the platform.
About the team

You will be a part of a small agile cross-functional team working on the development of the core of our Data Management Platform also cooperating with other Deloitte professionals and clients across Australia and the world.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
You are someone with:
Vast hands-on experience of Angular 6
Experience building data-driven dynamic web applications
Good knowledge and hands-on experience of HTML, SCSS, TypeScript, JS
Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, or other Cloud Infrastructure services
Understanding of web underlying concepts, technologies, and protocols (HTTP, TLS, API, etc.)
Understanding of cloud services and how to create scalable solutions
Bachelor´s Degree in Design, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
Self-starter, can-do and team player attitude
Australian citizenship is preferred (required to work with government projects and getting clearance for this)
Interest and passion in data and data processing is a preference
Understanding of data processing algorithms and data models is a preference
Knowledge of .Net Core is a bonus
Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and Transact-SQL is a bonus
Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive. We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space. Date: 04-Aug-2022

People Group,NA,UX / UI Designer,Gold Coast,"GREAT CULTURE & WORK WITH THE CREATIVE TEAM
EXCITING CAREER DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES
UP TO $100,000 + Super
ABOUT THE COMPANY

The cornerstone of the business collective is to provide solutions at the forefront of the superannuation industry that maximize and secure the financial wellbeing of every Australians in their retirement.

They are innovators in the superannuation investment space, delivering ever-evolving solutions for our clients via our team of highly skilled, vibrant, and forward-thinking individuals. An amazing facility with dynamic, high-energy, and relentless delivery of the next big wealth-building solution for our clients.
ABOUT THE ROLE
This is a newly created fixed-term opportunity, an in-house role reporting to the Marketing Manager.
This will include:
Provide outstanding support to the marketing team in the development of multiple website UX/UI elements
Design sites that engage clients of specific age ranges and demographics, holding interest, while being simple to use
Provide insight and support to assist in delivering the broader marketing strategy
Ensure compliance, exceptional quality credentials and deadlines are always met
Conduct UX research for the various brands
Create user personas and sitemaps
Keep up to date with the latest UX/UI trends
Work closely with the web developer to create and update websites and landing pages
ABOUT THE CANDIDATE
This role will be perfectly suited to a Designer who enjoys working on a variety of exciting and innovative projects across a group of companies where things change quickly!
You will have the following:
3+ Years’ experience as a UX/UI
Responsive design skills
Strong UI / Product Background
Design experience with Desktop, mobile devices, and cross-platform environments, responsive design
Understanding of the strategy/reasoning behind the UI/UX
Prototyping/wireframing etc.
Experience using Figma (or equivalent program)
Remarkable self-motivation and comfortable working autonomously, as well as collaboratively within a small team
WHAT ARE YOUR NEXT STEPS
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your resume, or call Hans Swartz now on 0406 045 525 525.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion GREAT CULTURE & WORK WITH THE CREATIVE TEAM

Telethon Institute for Child Health Research,3.6,Web Application Developer,Australia,"The Opportunity
We have a great opportunity for an enthusiastic individual (or individuals), with a breadth of technical skills to join our Biometrics team here at the Telethon Kids Institute.

This team works closely with our researchers and is focused on the development of health care data management systems that incorporate data capture, storage, and reporting. The codebases for some systems are mature, while some are still under active development by the team (with a client based UAT cycle). The systems leverage a range of technologies including Angular, .NET Core, and DevExpress tools/controls.
In addition, the team also administer a number of other platforms in the healthcare/health research space, so opportunities for diversity in this role exist.
The Role

The position sits within our Data Services team (a part of our Biometrics unit) and is ideal for someone who is keen to work within a small technical team, potentially be a full-stack developer, and enjoys collaborating closely with clients – in this case our research teams.
Your day-to-day activities will include:
Contributing to solutions design (structure, functionality, discussions with client),
Implementing/developing solutions (web interface implementation, database integration),
Solution completion (deployment, UAT review, bug fixing, maintenance), and
Contributing to system documentation.

This full-time position will be offered on a 2-year contract initially, with the possibility of further extension. We are open to discussing the possibility of reduced hours and/or flexible start and finish times, dependant on the successful candidate.
About You

If you are looking for an opportunity to apply your strong technical expertise and are excited to support our researchers in improving the health and wellbeing of children, then we want to hear from you!
Additionally, the successful applicant will have the following experience/skills:
Experience integrating Microsoft Web API/ REST Architecture.
Knowledge of MS SQL (2016)
Experience in Microsoft .Net tools, Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code
Ability to analyse and understand existing applications and suggest areas for enhancement.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work both independently and within a team-oriented environment
Strong documentation skills, and customer service focus
High technical skills and experience with Angular 8 (and above), .NET Core, .NET 4.5+ as well as DevExpress
Framework, Entity Framework and MVC are highly desirable but not essential for this position.
We are driving inclusion and diversity as part of the way we work. If you meet a number of the requirements (and not all), we encourage you to submit your application.
Our Culture
Our aim is to create a workplace where people are respected and encouraged to fulfil their potential. We encourage a workforce that is innovative, eager to acquire knowledge and enhance skills
column2: we embrace all employee differences and foster a culture that supports diversity and inclusion.

column1: We value our people and in return, you will be rewarded with a competitive remuneration package and as a not-for-profit this includes salary packaging of up to $15,899 (increases your take home pay!) and the opportunity to be part of a long-standing organisation.

We offer excellent training and development opportunities and generous staff benefits including flexible working conditions, Christmas shutdown as extra annual leave, paid parental leave, social activities and a health and wellbeing program.
How to apply
If you think that this is the right role and an exciting new challenge for you, please click on 'Apply Now' to navigate to our Career Site to view the Job Description and submit your application.
Your cover letter (no more than 2 pages) should specifically address your skills and experience outlined in the “About You” section above.
Applications will only be accepted through our career portal. If you are experiencing technical difficulties with our online portal, please direct your query to recruitment@telethonkids.org.au

We offer excellent training and development opportunities and generous staff benefits including flexible working conditions, Christmas shutdown as extra annual leave, paid parental leave, social activities and a health and wellbeing program.
How to apply
If you think that this is the right role and an exciting new challenge for you, please click on 'Apply Now' to navigate to our Career Site to view the Job Description and submit your application.
Your cover letter (no more than 2 pages) should specifically address your skills and experience outlined in the “About You” section above.
Applications will only be accepted through our career portal. If you are experiencing technical difficulties with our online portal, please direct your query to recruitment@telethonkids.org.au
Contact Name: Matt Cooper
Contact Email: matt.cooper@telethonkids.org.au

University of Southern Queensland,4.1,PeopleSoft Developer,Toowoomba,"Remuneration range $106,966 to $118,279 pa
Full-time continuing appointment
Toowoomba campus
ICT Services
About us
Building on its strengths as Australia’s leading regional University,
UniSQ’s vision is to be renowned for innovation and excellence in
education, student experience, research and engagement. Guided by our
core values of respect, integrity and excellence, the University’s
Strategic Plan 2021 - 2025 outlines our commitment to creating and
sharing knowledge, transforming lives and solving the problems that
matter to our world.
ICT Services at UniSQ is focused on providing client-focused,
sustainable, high-quality services and support to students and staff,
no matter where they are located.
We are currently seeking a highly skilled person to join the
Enterprise Applications team to provide application development
expertise and support the Team Leader (Enterprise Applications) on
emerging issues, critical support factors and training needs in
respect of existing ICT applications. The primary focus of expertise
for this position (but not limited to) will be Microsoft technologies.
What you will do
Reporting to the Team Leader (Enterprise Applications), you will
apply your expert ICT technical knowledge to ensure the effective
development, integration, support, maintenance and enhancement of the
University’s Enterprise ICT applications and projects. In particular,
you will:
work with several technologies and packages to help with specific
University requirements and interfaces to other systems
assist in the planning, design, development, testing, and
implementation of new applications, and changes to existing applications
assist in assessment of the impact of new technologies and
products on existing applications
liaise with product suppliers for technical support of
applications
facilitate and encourage use and continued quality growth of the
application code repositories.
What will help you succeed?
Key to your success in this role will be your ability to communicate
clearly with a wide range of internal and external clients. You will
also demonstrate a high level ability to work effectively in a team
environment and actively contribute to knowledge sharing.
Additionally, you will have:
a degree with major studies in computing or a relevant discipline,
with extensive experience in application development,
implementation, integration and testing (or an equivalent
combination of relevant experience and/or education/training)
well-developed skills and experience in delivering analysis,
design, coding, testing, implementation and documentation in support
and maintenance of computer systems, or as part of a software
development project
demonstrated ability to troubleshoot, determine the root cause of
issues and design and implement effective solutions
Demonstrated knowledge of data and business analysis skills and
the awareness of project management practices and methodologies
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality, consult,
negotiate and provide authoritative information and advice
Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment
High level analytical skills to generate viable options and
develop solutions to diverse workplace issues.
an ability to mentor and provide guidance to other team members.
Experience in database management systems (e.g., MySQL, Oracle,
PostgreSQL), Object Oriented Programming and web application development.
Experience in developing applications using PeopleCode, SQR, XML,
and COBOL.
Experience in developing web applications with at least one of the
following: PHP, Python, JavaScript / Typescript / JQuery, React, Vue
or Angular, Bootstrap.
Good knowledge of HTML and CSS.
Good understanding of designing and developing well-crafted
software using agile and lean approaches
Experience with Agile/SCRUM and waterfall methodologies.
Experience with git version control.
Please note, appointment will be made to the title of
Application Engineer.
Location:
Based at UniSQ’s Toowoomba campus, the Toowoomba region offers a
relaxed lifestyle and family-friendly atmosphere and is a great choice
for those wanting to escape big city life whilst still pursuing their
career goals.
The University offers a range of different ways of working and
connecting across our physical and virtual spaces to meet the needs of
our students, partners and community. We value diversity and aim to
foster an inclusive environment that is underpinned by our values and
champions, embraces and respects differences. We support and encourage
applications from all diversity groups.
With an increasingly diverse workforce, we understand that careers
may be placed on hold or limited throughout many life circumstances.
We recognise the importance of considering achievement relative to
opportunity and encourage you to outline factors such as career
breaks, gender, family, or other factors which may have resulted in a
limited career progression.
For enquiries regarding this position, please contact Andrew Yong,
Manager (Enterprise Applications) on telephone +61 7 4631 1496 or email
Andrew.Yong@usq.edu.au .
Reference No: 0248_08/22
Term: Full time continuing appointment (36 hrs/wk)
Salary: Total remuneration range $106,966 to $118,279
pa (includes salary range of $90,381 to $99,940 pa, employer
superannuation contributions of 17% of salary and annual leave loading)
Closes: Saturday, 3 September 2022
At UniSQ, we are united by our core values of Respect, Integrity and
Excellence, which guide our daily actions and decision making.
If you think you can bring this role to life, we invite you to
submit your resume/CV along with a two-page statement outlining your
motivation and suitability for the role. You can find out more

Edison Talent,NA,Web Designer,Brisbane,"The opportunity

Established in the 90’s, our client is a market leading digital agency who specialise in supporting local and regional businesses. As a result of continued re-innovation throughout the decades and never straying from their moto of supporting local business, they have experienced exponential growth.

As a result, they are now looking for a Web Designer to join a growing team of design experts and external clients to create mock-ups, landing pages and digital design assets for websites and digital platforms.
What are we looking for?

We are on the hunt for a passionate Web Designer who loves to use their exceptional design and layout skills to create contemporary and innovative websites that are elegant for the user from concept through to launch.
To succeed in this role, you will have experience in the below area’s
HTML, CSS and Wordpress
Full Adobe Creative Suite
Design tools such as Sketch or Zeplin
Design experience in both Web and Digital
Worked both internal and client side – ideally agency side exp though not essential
Enjoy collaborating with Developers to create digital solutions for both external clients and internal projects
What you’ll get out of it
Support in abundance.
Training, development and a true opportunity to further your skills and experience which in return, furthers your career.
Work-life balance
WFH once trained
A positive working environment and supportive culture
1 minute walk to cafes, bars, restaurants and shopping
What to do next
If you’re interested, then submit your application by clicking the “APPLY” button.
Contact
Tracey Vela

Xamarin Developer
Position Summary

PURPOSE Marketing,NA,FRONTEND WEB DEVELOPER,Launceston,"ABOUT THE COMPANY
PURPOSE Marketing is a digital and creative marketing agency based in Launceston CBD.

Due to continued success, we’re growing and have a terrific opportunity for an experienced Frontend Web Developer to join an innovative, fun-loving agency that has an established, varied portfolio of clients in Tasmania and Australia.

As an agency, we think differently to others, we love what we do and create marketing solutions that look spectacular and achieve results.Being a specialist agency, our clients sit across a number of categories: FMCG, Retail, Luxury Brands, F& B, Travel, Events, Hospitality & B2b.

The agency is home to a fun group of like-minded, professional, passionate people who are dedicated to making a real difference to business, across our core disciplines: strategy, creative and digital.
ABOUT THE ROLE

We’re looking for an experienced Front-end Web Developer who can make a real contribution and add value to our business. With proven experience and a skill in building dynamic websites and app solutions, you’ll be able to hit the ground running.

Working as part of a team, you’ll work alongside other web developers, creatives, designers and copywriters. One of your core roles will be to develop and build, responsive, fully standards compliant websites and other solutions from approved designs on time and to a brief.

With a good, positive personality, you’ll be organised and produce work to a high level, which will be needed given that you will be working on a number of projects each week, actively contributing to the creation and testing of front-end experiences.
EXPERIENCE
Essential for this role
Minimum of two years’ experience, working in a Frontend development role gained while working within a commercial business, digital or marketing agency.
Ownership and commitment to quality and best practice.
Functional knowledge and experience using: HTML5, CSS3, JS ES6, PHP, Wordpress.
Love working in a small team, being productive relatively rapidly, and getting straight into the “thick of it”.
Strong problem diagnosis and creative problem-solving skills.
Committed to developing your skills, perfecting your craft in a collaborative environment.
Enjoy working on a mix on new and existing projects in any given week.
DESIRABLE
A strong understanding or experience of working with some or all the following:
MySQL / MariaDB, Git, jQuery, ReactJS, SASS, SCSS or Less.
Shopify / Sitecore.
UI + UX principals, web standards.
Cross-browser / cross-platform compatibility issues.
Security principles, specifically how they apply to e.Commerce applications/user data storage.
Material Design / Material-UI / Adobe Suite.
AWS / Azure / Google Cloud.
Webpack / Gulp / Grunt.
NPM / Yarn
Domain Name Management.
JOIN US

This is an ideal opportunity for an experienced and passionate Frontend Web Developer to become part of a dynamic, digital and creative agency that is growing, has fun and genuinely cares for its clients and employees.
APPLY FOR THIS ROLE
If you’re looking for a new challenge and wish to move your career forward with PURPOSE, apply today and please include the following:
Covering Letter, including an indication of expected salary.
Your Updated Resume.
Detail of projects worked upon / Github.
The remuneration package will be determined by experience.
All applications will be assessed as they are received.
Applications will not be accepted from recruitment agencies.
You must be an Australian Citizen or hold a valid visa that allows you to work in Australia.
The successful candidate will work from our Launceston office (remote working isn’t possible at this time).
Please note: Only successful candidates will be contacted.
Apply today, fill out the form below or email us at: careers@purposemarketing.com.au ABOUT THE COMPANY

Hunter Industries,NA,Senior Developer - ReactJS & React Native (REMOTE ROLE),Melbourne,"Hunter Industries is a leading “internet of things” manufacturer and has been shipping internet-enabled smart watering irrigation systems since 2011. You’ll be working on a product that is used by millions of customers around the world that helps the environment by saving water.We are currently reworking our ReactJS web application to work on iOS and Android utilising React Native. You’ll be a key member of this team as we build out our applications for web and mobile using React & React Native as our core.You will be a smart, quick-thinking developer who isn’t afraid to learn new technologies and who has the enthusiasm and drive to work with a team of like-minded developers. Whilst we are predominately hiring for front end work, you’ll have the opportunity to enhance your skills in a wide variety of cloud technologies such as GraphQL, AWS IOT, Beanstalk, Docker, EC2 and Memcached.You can learn more about our technology stack here - https://hydrawise.medium.com/.Our team all work remotely spread out across the world with developers in Vietnam, Australia and the US. The majority of our team is based in Melbourne, Australia.*This is a fully remote role with the expectation that you reside in Australia (preferably) or New Zealand and are able to work in the Australian time zone to maximize collaboration with our existing developers.Skills & RequirementsWe welcome your application if you have: Excellent front end development skills utilizing SOLID design principlesMinimum 3 years experience with ReactJS and 1 year experience with React NativeExperience in writing unit testsProven experience developing or maintaining a significantly sized applicationExperience in GraphQL or AWS will be an advantageYou see learning new technologies as a challengeHighly technical, hands-on coder with great attention to detail – you want to understand why something works or doesn’t work. If something doesn’t seem right, you’ll strive for a better way to do it.This could be your dream job if: you are smart, love to pick up new technologies and know how to use your brain to adapt to new situations based on your past experienceyou want to feel like you are making a differenceyou have high standards in everything that you doIf this seems like the right match for you then please apply. Get to know more about us, our people and our products by visiting https://hydrawise.com.About Hunter IndustriesHunter Industries is a leader in the Internet of Things revolution for irrigation. We manufacture an internet-enabled watering system which allows users to control their garden's watering from anywhere in the world using a web browser or our Apple and Android apps. We apply complex algorithms based on global weather data and local conditions to individually adjust watering schedules based on temperature, rainfall, humidity and wind speed.Our philosophy is that using a watering system should be simple and allow you to save water by putting the right amount of water on your garden at the right time. We integrate with weather forecasting systems and internet-based weather stations providing users with real-time information on weather conditions.The key part of our product is not the hardware we sell - it is the ease of use of the applications we provide.Why us?Do you love being at the center of product development?With Hunter you will:have the opportunity to heavily shape the evolution of the Hydrawise product.have the benefit of working in a nimble, fast-moving environment with the backup and support of one of the world's largest irrigation companieshave the opportunity to showcase your design skills.Job Type: Full-timePay: $120,000.00 – $140,000.00 per yearBenefits:Work from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplementary Pay:Annual bonusApplication Question(s):What is your annual salary expectation (AUD) for this position?Work Authorisation:Australia (Required)Expected Start Date: 06/09/2022 Hunter Industries is a leading “internet of things” manufacturer and has been shipping internet-enabled smart watering irrigation systems since 2011. Laravel, PHP
Understanding of cloud technology (AWS)

Docker

Git and Atlassian Stack
Benefits
